metadata.feature_description: Automatically generate rich previews for URLs shared in posts

steps.action: Navigate to Activity Stream on Community page
steps.expected: Activity Stream with post input area visible
steps.actual: Activity Stream displayed with 'Tell the world something...' input area

steps.action: Type GitHub URL (https://www.github.com) followed by space
steps.expected: URL should be detected and preview should appear
steps.actual: URL preview appeared with GitHub title, description, and image

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Preview multiple URLs in single post

steps.action: Type two URLs (google.com and youtube.com) in post input
steps.actual: Only the first URL (Google) generated a preview - this is expected behavior as the system shows one preview at a time

steps.expected: No preview should appear for invalid/non-existent URL
steps.actual: No URL preview was generated for the invalid URL - handled gracefully

steps.expected: Preview should show available metadata or title only
steps.actual: Preview showed only the title 'Example Domain' without description or image

steps.expected: Preview should show title, description, and image
steps.actual: Preview displayed with YouTube title, description, and image carousel showing '1 of 3' images

steps.action: Type URL to generate preview (GitHub URL)
steps.actual: GitHub URL preview appeared with title, description, and image

steps.action: Click the close button (X) on the URL preview card
steps.expected: URL preview should be removed while URL text remains
steps.actual: URL preview was successfully removed, URL text remained in the post input area

steps.expected: Preview should work for different domain
steps.actual: BBC URL preview appeared with title 'BBC Home - Breaking News, World News, US News, Sports, Business, Innovation, Climate, Culture, Travel, Video & Audio' and description

observations: URL preview is triggered when typing a URL followed by a space character - using fill() or paste does not trigger detection
The close button on URL preview (actStr_closePreviewBtn) is not visible in accessibility tree but can be clicked via JavaScript
When multiple URLs are entered, only the first URL generates a preview - this appears to be by design
The PreviewUrl API endpoint uses Utilities.GetLinkData() to fetch Open Graph metadata from URLs
